result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel G. Matthews was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay $500.00 fine plus costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees.**NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT 
---------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
---------------------

No contact with the victim(s) without the victim's and Agent's consent. No alcohol. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
---------------------
Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. Any prescription medications to be made known to the Agent, and taken as prescribed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel G. Matthews

records.addlTxt: Defendant Daniel G. Matthews in court.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Daniel G. Matthews.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Andrew Herrmann. Matter before the Court for plea and sentencing - **SEE ATTACHED MINUTE SHEET**

Defendant Daniel G. Matthews in court.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Daniel G. Matthews.  Attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel G. Matthews in court.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Daniel G. Matthews. Victim is also present in court. Defendant initial appearance he is provided a copy of the criminal complaint, waived its reading. Counsel enters a not guilty on behalf of defendant. Speedy trial rights reserved.  Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court. Minutes filed.
Status hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.
Original Warrant filed with the court.

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH LAUDERDALE LANDING AND B.L.G. dob 4-13-1983 OR RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel G. Matthews in court, in custody by video. Attorney Mackenzie Renner for defendant. Defendant qualifies for SPD. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
